sentences.en: Crimes of violence and attacks on the person require more or less pluck.
sentences.cn: 造谣惑众和人身攻击是多多少少需要有一些勇气的.

sentences.en: He can't pluck up the courage to leave home.
sentences.cn: 他鼓不起离开家的勇气.

sentences.en: He could not pluck up enough courage to ask her to marry him.
sentences.cn: 他鼓不起足够的勇气向她求婚.

sentences.en: He finally plucked up enough courage to ask her out.
sentences.cn: 他终于鼓起勇气约她出去。

sentences.en: He has been trying for weeks to pluck up the courage to pop the question.
sentences.cn: 几星期以来,他一直想鼓起勇气求婚.

sentences.en: If you had the pluck of a weevil in a biscuit , you would catch them still.'
sentences.cn: 你们只要有干面包里的虫子那样的胆量, 就一定能抓住他们. ”

sentences.en: It takes a lot of pluck to stand up to a bully.
sentences.cn: 不向恃强凌弱者屈服需要很大勇气。

sentences.en: It took me about two hours to pluck up courage to call.
sentences.cn: 我用了大约2个小时才鼓起勇气打电话。

sentences.en: Little companies are known for their pluck and perseverance, even in the face of a recession.
sentences.cn: 小公司的勇气和坚毅是出了名的，即使面对经济衰退也是如此。

sentences.en: Peregrine falcons usually pluck the feathers and strip the flesh off their bird prey.
sentences.cn: 游隼捕到鸟类猎物时,通常是先拔掉它们的羽毛,再把肉撕下来.

sentences.en: She showed a lot of pluck in dealing with the intruders.
sentences.cn: 她对付那些闯入的歹徒表现得十分勇敢.

sentences.en: She tried to pluck out some of her grey hairs.
sentences.cn: 她想拔掉一些自己的白头发.

sentences.en: The older the goose the harder to pluck.
sentences.cn: 〔谚语〕年纪越大,越是一毛不拔.

sentences.en: Tom begged her to pluck up hope again, and she said she could not.
sentences.cn: 汤姆求她再打起精神来, 可她说不能.

sentences.en: With a few pluck at the string of his banjo, everybodyis singing along.
sentences.cn: 他拨了拨班卓琴的琴弦, 每个人就都跟著唱了起了.

trans.tran_cn: 勇气，精神，内脏，快而猛的拉，〈俚〉不及格

trans.tran_en: to force yourself to be brave and do something you are afraid of doing

trans.tran_cn: 采，摘，拔掉，鼓起（勇气等），弹（乐器）
